formalText: Patient talked about getting ready for a job conference in a couple of days, and hopefully going to have interviews.
He feels like he has teaching experience.
And personally states "I am very good".
Like I'm a really really good teacher".
In session there was effort to make sure he didn't feel upset and subconscious.
He states, "I'm not doing so well.
Yeah, extremely sad"
He talked about his new work opportunities "I have to see if the schools want to hire me.
He states he feels beat.
States, "I just feel like I've been repeatedly punched in the jaw, like beat up, just tired"
He doesn't know what to do when he thinks about work a lot
He just felt sad.
He doesn't know how to function.
As the therapist it seems like his depression is slipping into a sort of, "kick the shit out of you in every possible way and for everything you try to do".
What he was doing before wasn't working for the depression.
When asked "Was it bad for you.. were things bad last night?" he responded
"No, they weren't so bad"
He was feeling really crummy the morning when he was going to have an ECT and h I had asked "does it tend to help right away or does it take awhile?"
And he referred to there being kind of 'lift' usually fairly soon after. We didn't talk until a day or late or later a day or maybe two later maybe three because he was back in the hospital.
I recalled he made it clear that he didn't feel any better. The decision was made talking to a doctor that he really needed to be back in the hospital and that was the best thing
He was starting to lean on a little bit and he started to appreciate getting some help on this.
That day determined to show that it wasn't going to be stronger than the depression.
